list_definition.definition: to give (a piece of work, power etc) to someone else

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He delegates a great deal of work to his assistant.

list_definition.definition: an elected representative (to a conference, Parliament, committee etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The delegates met in the conference room.

list_ex_of_english: In 1912, however, authorization for export was delegated to a trading company for a fixed payment.
The manager agent delegates tasks to the garden designing agent and the house interior designing agent.
The decision to consent to certain forms of treatment may also be delegated to a manager when appropriate.
The government had presented its recommendations ; now the delegates were presenting theirs.
The extension of nurse prescribing may also mean that more nursing activities are delegated to unregistered staff.
Dissent was so fragmented as to leave delegates feeling impotent and isolated rather than determinedly oppositional.
The third phase delegates the majority of the work to the tools.
At constitutional conventions held in the transition from territory to statehood, delegates designed state governments with these goals in mind.
